SENT.plain: In the so-called "cat-eye" syndrome are associated the following malformations: coloboma iridis, anal atresia, pre-auricular fistullae with an extra 47th chromosome of the G group type
About twenty cases have already been reported
Some are familial cases and some have the complete phenotype but without the extra chromosome
Even if the structure of the material of this element is doubtful, its responsability in the phenotype is likely
This case is reported since the patient has pituitary dwarfism and normal intelligence
